data.title: ??? Absolutely nothing special.
data.text: I'm confused... this is barely a step above a McDs type burger. Nothing compared to In & Out or 5 Guys!!! Fries were good at least. And darn cheap, so there's that...

data.title: Ok P. T.'s but Not My Favorite Location...
data.text: I've only gone to this one, which is closest to where I live, a couple of times because in my experience the order is incorrectly delivered. The food seems to taste the same, same quality, so it's still a choice on my list. Just check your order prior to departure ;-)

data.title: Great hamburgers and fast service.
data.text: I like the hamburgers here although some might find them a bit on the small side.  The french fries are long and on the thin side.  I like the ones at McDonalds better.  I haven't tried the milkshakes, but I hear they are good.  They also have breakfast.

data.title: Excellent - every time
data.text: My office is close to this location, so just about every day one of the 10 of us is heading to PTerrys. SO GOOD. Breakfast, lunch or dinner - all good.

data.title: Veggie Burgers
data.text: I do not eat beef and I love that P Terry has a great veggie option.  The French Fries are also delicious.

data.title: the Austin-local version of In & Out
data.text: organic ingredients, fast service and it hits the nail on the head for fast food! freshly baked cookies, milk shakes and lemonade? Yes please. The menu is basic, leaving you with a few simple decisions to make. Onions are not standard (good for me) on the burgers. If you want to support a local Austin business, but want the fast food too - hit up any of the P Terry's in town.

data.title: It could only get better
data.text: It was just ok if you want a little more than McDonalds type burgers. Nothing stood out as spectacular.

data.title: Fast food
data.text: Was a little disappointed in the quality of food. Very simple food, reminds me of McDonalds. Staff was friendly and restaurant was clean.

data.title: Good burger
data.text: great for quick in and out service (good service, never gets the order wrong) great fries. the veggie burger is liked by my spousal unit.

data.title: Do you love In-N-Out Burger?
data.text:
Let me start by stating that I'm originally from Southern CA and was an In-N-Out Burger addict.  I'm serious-like to the point I'd route my trips so I'd pass by at least one.  
When I moved to Austin in '95 there wasn't anything even close and I had withdrawals. Finally, around 2007, I discovered P Terry's. Halleluiah!  They managed to clone the burger and even the simple menu was almost exact.  
From their natural, Angus beef, to the "special sauce", daily hand- cut potatoes for the fry's, they nailed it!
I haven't tried to order one Animal Style, but I'm in heaven.
Thank goodness for P Terry's!

data.title: Great Milk Shakes!
data.text: Just popped in to grab a nice cold milk shake and I was surprised to see that they had so many flavors. I went with the double chocolate and it was awesome. Not too thick that you get dizzy from trying to drink it through a straw. I was curious about the root beer milkshake, I'll try that one next.

data.title: tasty!
data.text: tasty burgers and fries, fast food that tastes good.  Easy access, plenty of comfortable seating and fast service

data.title: P. Terry's Burger Stand really stands up
data.text:
If you need a great simple hamburger on the go, then P. Terry's is the place for you. Quality natural ingredients (100% Angus Beef)  & a speedy drive through will have you fed and on your way in no time!
They also have breakfast, chicken sandwiches & nice thick milk shakes. Many locations throughout Austn. I bet there's one near YOU.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Best "home style" burgers in town! and prices are reasonable. My grandchildren love to go here, and my pocket book does too!  they also have some yummy cookies. They're pretty large though so you might want to share with someone.

data.title: One of the Best
data.text: Not the BEST burger in Austin, but that's just my opinion. P Terry is very Austin, it's quick, cheap and a fantastic burger. The fries get soggy very quickly, but while they are hot I love them.

data.title: Great Burger
data.text: The service was quick and friendly. The food was very good. The price was ok, but probably should be a smidge cheaper as McDonald's is on the opposite corner. That being said... My burger was hot, juicy, and EXACTLY like I'd ordered it. I would definitely eat there again :)

data.title: AWESOME!
data.text: My girlfriends and I came here late night for french fries - best ever!  Loved them so much we came back the next night for more!!!!  Great tee shirts for souvenirs. Loved this place.

data.title: Love P Terry's - food is always good
data.text: When my kids feel like having hamburgers, P Terry's is always their first choice.  They have great french fries!

data.title: Just plain YUMMY!
data.text: I absolutely love that they have an option to wrap your burger in lettuce verses a bun! It's a little messy but oh so worth it! Great prices and of so yummy food!

data.title: Burgers Between Beers
data.text: Date needed some food before we did some more music on 6th Street and P.Terry's was just what the tourist needed.  Fast, friendly, cheap and good.  Freshly pealed potatoes cut into slim fries were tasty.  Good coffee also.  Nice job P.Terry's.....keep up the good work!
